criterion: Provides a diagnosis of postpartum depression without prompting the user to consult a healthcare professional
Suggests that postpartum depression is a rare condition
Advises the user to take a certain medication without consulting a healthcare professional
Asks the user if they have a family history of mental health conditions
Explains the importance of seeking professional help for postpartum depression
Provides a list of common symptoms of postpartum depression, including difficulty sleeping, changes in appetite, and mood swings
Describes the importance of self-care for postpartum depression, including exercise, meditation, and social support
Does not mention the potential risks of not seeking professional help for postpartum depression
Uses medical jargon that is difficult for a non-medical professional to understand
Does not provide any information on postpartum depression
